title: Springfield shirt buyers
body:
If you're from Springfield, or within a reasonable driving distance, and bought one of the limited edition Moxie shirts, you're cordially invited to drop by the theater and pick up your merchandise so I don't have to send it. In exchange for saving me $3+ on shipping, I'll give you a quick tour of the theater AND a souvenir cockroach... if you so desire. However, please remember that the theater is still a MAJOR construction site, and I won't be held liable if a board falls on your head or I "accidentally" shot you in the leg with the nail gun. You've been warned, Springfield!

If you'd like to pick up your shirt(s) and/or buttons, feel free to drop by between 5:00 and 7:00 on Monday or Tuesday of next week (May 2nd and 3rd). I'll have the buttons and shirts with me, but NO STICKERS. They still haven't arrived yet, but you can always drop back by later to pick them up once they finally arrive.

As for everyone else OUTSIDE of Springfield, your shirts will be sent next week, sans-sticker. Once I get the stickers, I'll fold them into an envelope and send them your way. Fair enough? Good.

I'm wearing my shirt right now... it's AWESOME!

PS - If you haven't yet bought a shirt, we still have 9 left (as of this post). If you'd like one, I'll have them with me at the theater on Monday and Tuesday, OR you can still buy them online. There's only a few sizes left, so I'd buy them while you still can... Woo HOO!
author: Dan

comments.author: Evan Erwin
comments.body:
Man, why couldn't you be opening a theater closer to Oak Ridge? C'mon man, we got nuclear power for those nail guns...

I would love to come by and provide free labor. And bad jokes. More latter than former, of course.

Anyway, I would like to wish (secretly) that a sticker may find its way in my package, but I doubt it. I -so- didn't earn it, but in my mind yes, I did earn it (see, that's a little setup-and-execute there). The Wifely Spiel about What Are You Spending Our Money On Again felt very sticker-worthy.

comments.author: nathan springer
comments.body: sweet we get to see the moxie plus get a shirt, ah my life is grand.
